intro: Platostoma africanum, commonly known as the African flat lichen, is a species of lichen that exhibits a unique combination of fungal and algal components. It belongs to the family Parmeliaceae and is characterized by its flat, crust-like thallus that adheres tightly to its substrate. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found on rocks and tree bark in sub-Saharan Africa. Its structure is composed of a fungal mycelium intertwined with photosynthetic algae, which together perform essential metabolic functions. Due to its specialized habitat, Platostoma africanum plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its environment.
